newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: P.Telecom boosts mobile phone business.
newsitem.headline: P.Telecom boosts mobile phone business.

text.p: Portugal Telecom said that the number of mobile phone clients rose 11.6 percent over the first quarter of 1997 to 370,824 compared with end-1996.
The number was up 97 percent from the first quarter a year earlier.

In a report on its first quarter activities, it said that according to published industry reports, its market share stood at 50.7 percent compared with 50.1 percent at the end of last year and 49.0 percent a year ago.

The number of installed fixed lines rose 1.2 percent in the first quarter of 1997 to 3.87 million, up 5.4 percent year-on-year. Market penetration increased to 38.8 phones per 100 inhabitants compared with 38.5 at end-1996 and 37 at the end of the first quarter last year.
The number of digital lines rose over the first three months to 80.4 percent from 79.4 percent last December.
Internet accounts nearly quadrupled to 44,400 percent from 11,336 a year ago.
